Title: Switch to libev
Body: This PR close #54.  Enchantments: 1. Simpler 2. One thread for all IO 3. Less memory copying (one or two in worst case)

Title: Vim modeline fix
Body: This makes the change that you requested. I think for mode et  it should still be there as you have in most of the python scripts.

Title: launch enable setpoint plugins for APM
Body: As of ArduCopter 3.2  APM supports position and velocity setpoints via SET_POSITION_TARGET_LOCAL_NED.

Title: distance_sensor small enhancements
Body: @vooon new PR. The static stuff was added cause it was giving me a non-static related error. But then I realized I was defining the variables in the wrong place. This PR adds what you recommended+error correction.

Title: VIBRATION msg support
Body: WIP: This will fail cause it requires mavlink release update on ROS.  **Update:** mavlink version on release: https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/issues/308#issuecomment-111607740

Title: Orientation enum name
Body: - Added names to orientation list; - Added functions: one to retrieve the name when having the enum  other to retrieve the number when having the name.

Title: mavros_msgs package
Body: This PR fix #354.  Stages: - [x] Create msgs package and move IDL files - [x] Fix mavros package build - [x] Fix extras package build - [x] Fix mavros python lib - [x] Fix mavros python scripts - [x] Fix extras python scripts

Title: add MANUAL_CONTROL mavlink message publisher as a new plugin
Body: I've created a new plugin which simply publishes the MANUAL_CONTROL mavlink as a ROS message. This is a little easier to use than the raw RC input.  I would like to also receive switches states (such as AUX1  ...) but it appears the pixhawk does not publish these  AFAIK.

Title: Event launcher 385
Body: WIP thread for #385.

Title: Altitude plugin
Body: @vooon Added a new plugin for the altitude message. PX4 implementation is in the queue. https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/pull/3234

Title: Added Optitrack Motive full compatibility to mocap position
Body: Implemented Optitrack Motive coordinates uses (zxy) - Added /mavros/mocap/use_motive_zxy param (true use zxy ENU coordiates  false use xyz ENU coordinates) - Added auto transform from zxy to xyz (if use_motive_zxy set to true)

Title: modified mavteleop to support RC modes
Body: update to `mavteleop` to allow support modes in -rc mode - modes are read from the `~rc_modes` in yaml format eg. with `<rosparam>` (see examples below) - tested with [Futaba flight controller](http://www.realflight.com/products/gpmz4520.html) and [Logitech gamepad](http://gaming.logitech.com/en-roeu/product/f710-wireless-gamepad) - removed support for arm/disarm in RC mode as it is already available over RC with stick in lower-right position

Title: Mavlink 2 0 support WIP
Body: This is WIP PR for Mavlink 2.0 support.  Fixes #543 (#553)  #522  #286.

Title: WIP Add odometry message to local position plugin coordinate frame review
Body: This PR will add a nav_msgs/Odometry output to the local position plugin  solving #470 directly.  Additionally #438 will be addressed by this PR with an in-depth analysis of the current coordinate frames used  transformations between frames  and making these frames as [REP 105](http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0105.html) and [REP 103](http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0103.html) compliant with minimal impact on the current user base (e.g. with changing as few frame names as possible). # Coordinate Frame Examination - [x] Review frames currently in use   - [x] Determine if renaming frames to be REP 105 compliant is worth the disruption to current user base   - [x] Review rotations between current frames in [uas_frame_conversions.cpp](https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/blob/master/mavros/src/lib/uas_frame_conversions.cpp)   - [x] Update frame naming and rotation methods as necessary # Odometry Message Publication - [x] Publish Odometry message    - [x] Determine proper frames to be placed in header and child frame within the message   - [x] Calculate linear and angular velocities in the associated child frame   - [x] Determine way in which to provide the pose and twist covariances from the local position message # Documentation  [Here](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1bDhaozrUu9F915T58WGzZeOM-McyU20dwxX-NRum1KA) is a discussion of the proposed changes and why they are being made.  To help facilitate ensuring frames are properly rotated I've [begun tabulating](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LnsWTblU92J5_SMinTvBvHJWx6sqvzFa8SKbn8TXlnU/edit?usp=sharing) each plugin's data and what frame it is represented in on the FCU.  Not being and Arducopter developer I will not be diving into  frame representations on that firmware stack but have included it anyway if someone wants to take the lead on it.

Title: Trouble Compiling MAVROS
Body: Hi      By using Aurelian Roy's helper scripts to setup Gazebo SITL/ROS  I've been experiencing issues to compile the workspace.     Link:   https://github.com/AurelienRoy/ardupilot_sitl_ros_tutorial/tree/master/scripts    What I did:     (src has been initialised)  wstool set -t src mavros --git https://github.com/alexbuyval/mavros.git  wstool update -t src    The issue is in step 5  when catkin_make.     OS: Ubuntu 14.04.3 LTS     The same error will occur if I compile mavros from other sources such as:   git clone https://github.com/mavlink/mavros.git  git clone https://github.com/erlerobot/mavros.git      I have tried installing the whole OS again from scratch for 2 times but the same error occur.     Please advice. Title: local vs fcu coordinate frame
Body: changed fcu frame to local_frame. assumption made: fcu is body frame and local_frame is fixed frame

Title: TSC21 adsb plugin
Body: Replaces #696.

Title: Timesync bypass mode
Body: That PR adds bypass mode to timesync plugin and UAS.    Issue #661.

Title: launch remove setpoint attitude from apm blacklist
Body: Ardupilot supports the SET_ATTITUDE_TARGET mavlink message so the setpoint-attitude should be removed from the blacklist.  This has been tested by a user.

Title: Odom review part 2
Body: - Added Covariation matrices rotations  - Added `MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE` enum `to_string`

Title: WIP Add odometry plugin
Body: This adds an odometry plugin that simplifies interaction with ROS based estimators.    @TSC21   @mhkabir

Title: Extras Odometry plugin
Body: Replaces #706     Squashed & rebased to simpler patch set.

Title: WIP Set framework to define offset between global origin and current local position
Body: This is WIP and pretends to implement a framework to set the global origin of the system so it can be used to compute the offset between the current `local_position_ned` of the drone and this same global origin. Useful for flexible nav between GPS denied environments and GPS permitted environments.    - [X] Add wrappers for `GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN` and `SET_GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN`  - [x] Add handler for `LOCAL_POSITION_NED_SYSTEM_GLOBAL_OFFSET`

Title: Use GeographicLib tools to guarantee ROS msg def and enhance features
Body: The purpose is to use the [GeographicLib](https://geographiclib.sourceforge.io/) to compute:    - [X] Geoid to Ellipsoid height and vice-versa (only done on `global_position.cpp` plugin for now)  - [x] Change UTM to ECEF and compute the local coordinates to publish the odometry  - [x] Update `HomePosition.msg` and add height conversion    I'm not very happy to include a build for it as an `ExternalProject` on `CMakeList.txt`  so probably I will add a dependency only to `geographiclib-tools` deb pkg and then add a command on `CMakeList.txt` to install the datasets.    The lib also allows to compute magnetic fields and gravity field for each coordinate  so we can probably add some usage for that in sensors.

Title: ADSB Plugin
Body: This adds a ADS-B (Automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast) wrapper so it can allow data reception/publish of modules.    - [X] Add handler for `ADSB_VEHICLE` and publish data to ROS msg - [Ping RX](http://www.uavionix.com/products/pingrx/)  - [x] Add ROS subscriber to publish msg to FCU (in case the ADS-B system is connected offboard - [pingUSB](http://www.uavionix.com/products/pingusb/))

Title: extras mocap_fake_gps to fake_gps
Body: This PR:   1. Replaces `mocap_fake_gps` by `fake_gps`  by generalizing the plugin to other pose sources besides MoCap  like vision-based ones  and letting the user choose which one he wants;   2. Uses the capabilities of `GeographicLib` to compute geocentric coordinates and velocities and apply the reverse translation to geodetic coordinates (using the WGS-84 ellipsoid);   3. Allows user input of the origin coordinates  `eph`  `epv`  GPS data rate and number of virtual visible satellites to the faked GPS;   4. Adds `GPS_FIX_TYPE` enumeration.

Title: WIP Plugins setpoint_attitude add sync between thrust and attitude
Body: - [x] Sync between thrust and pose msg  - [x] Sync between thrust and twist msg  - [x] Sync between thrust and transform

Title: Extras add ardupilot rangefinder plugin
Body: This add ardupilot rangefinder message support. It will be deprecated with next version that support DISTANCE_SENSOR msg

Title: build make geoid datasets install mandatory
Body: This obliges people running the dataset install script (`install_geographiclib_dataset.sh`) in order to avoid errors on height calculation  which was only launching an exception but no sigfault.

Title: Odom fix
Body: Rebased version of #816. Added some fixes.

Title: Plugins Extras Add debug plugin
Body: This resolves #796.  @jlecoeur FYI. If you are comfortable with ROS  you can give it a try yourself.    Related issue in PX4: https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/pull/7373.

Title: geolib_dataset script fix interpreter
Body: Fixes #853.

Title: GPS fix s frame_id changed to body fixed
Body: According to [ROS](http://docs.ros.org/jade/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/NavSatFix.html)  frame_id of NavSatFix message is   > This is a Euclidean frame relative to the vehicle  not a reference  ellipsoid.    So  usually  this should be `base_link`  not `map`.  Some ROS packages (like [robot_localization](http://wiki.ros.org/robot_localization)) rely on it to be specified exactly this way.     This pull request adds child_frame_id parameter for global_position plugin and uses it for     - global_position/global/header/frame_id  - global_position/raw/fix/header/frame_id  - global_position/local/child_frame_id (to make it complete)

Title: RPM plugin added for reporting Ardupilot RPM 226 message
Body: RPM plugin added for reporting Ardupilot RPM # 226 message  http://mavlink.org/messages/ardupilotmega#RPM

Title: Improve install_geographiclib_datasets sh script
Body: PR to support issue #867      - Ensure dataset files actually exist  not just directories which are empty if a download attempt fails   - Improve output  turn off debug   - Use builtin hash instead of which  more reliable

Title: Global position setpoint plugin
Body: This PR adds a plugin that allows to set global (GPS) setpoints. It accepts latitude/longitude in degrees  yaw  and local altitude. Then  it converts this to the required changes in local NED frame before it sends it to the FCU. This is tested with PX4 firmware in SITL with Gazebo.

Title: mavros_extras fake_gps add vision topic param to use other pose msg
Body: I am using fake_gps plugin with hector_SLAM. I had to change subscribe topic name for vision source so I added new vision param of subscribing topic name.

Title: mavros_extras Command_ack plugin added
Body: Plugin for listening to `COMMAND_ACK` messages from FCU and publishing them to ROS.

Title: Blacklist HIL for APM since it is not relevent
Body: Ardupilot doesn't support hardware in the loop so this plugin is not needed.    Additionally  this prevents  but doesn't fix  the issue in #822

Title: Added RPYT Setpoint
Body: Setpoint for Roll  Pitch  Yawrate  Thrust added  from ethz-asl fork.

Title: launch remove vision_pose_estimate from blacklist on ardupilot
Body: it is now support in Master starting from https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/commit/12fd19ea265babe6be716e7159d91d8f95be3512

Title: cmake fix FindGeographicLib for Debian systems
Body: This adds support for CMake finding GeographicLib when the shared libs are in `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/`. It restores the functionality that was lost with the simplification done in f2bda9739e202efdc61adc28acb2490051e35960.

Title: GPS accuracy wo approximations
Body: GPS accuracy published by mavros is now based on accuracies reported by FCU in `GPS_RAW_INT` message if using mavlink v2.0. Otherwise they are approximated by HDOP & VDOP values  scaled by GPS User Equivalent Range Error (UERE) measured in meters.  According to #1020.

Title: launch remove mocap_pose_estimate from apm blacklist
Body: This resolves [this issue](https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/issues/1080) by enabling the mocap_pose_estimate plugin.    The mocap_pose_estimate has been tested ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P3qllsrt-_M)  [blog](https://discuss.ardupilot.org/t/indoor-flight-with-external-navigation-data/29980)) and shown to work well.

Title: apm_config enable timesync and system for ardupilot
Body: ArduPilot has added support for handling of the TIMESYNC and SYSTEM_TIME messages and it seems to be working.    - documentation on the setup is [here on the AP developer wiki](ardupilot.org/dev/docs/ros-timesync.html) (should be visible about 10min after this PR was submitted)  - below is an image of the clocks syncronised between a TX2 companion computer and a Cube flight controller.    ![ros-time-sync-testing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1498098/48745653-96e7b680-ecaf-11e8-8a27-13c3f3fdb928.png)

Title: sys_status add MAV_TYPE as a parameter
Body: add MAV_TYPE as a parameter that can be changed with the yaml config file.

Title: sys_status add MAV_TYPE as a parameter
Body: New version of https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/pull/1092   I added cog lines for auto generation with the right names of a second array for MAV_TYPE.

Title: odom add ODOMETRY handler and ROS publisher
Body: This pull request is part of the effort to have a full odometry pipeline that allows sending and receiving odometry data. This implements the [`ODOMETRY`](https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html#ODOMETRY) handler in the `odom` plugin.    So to keep the consistency regarding the usage of `tf2` and tf lookups to apply the transforms  the `local_origin_ned`<->`fcu_frd` is published  in order to allow the following tf tree.    ![tf_tree](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5048656/50378602-e7935c00-062d-11e9-870e-709acd7866c3.png)    Soon enough the above transform implementation should be brought to the frame transform API and replace the static Eigen math being applied.    Here's a [demo video](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1gUFYf4k2TBTApRXXH6QAzUDJwk-QHvQX)  which allows to see the Odometry data in both Rviz  `rostopic echo` and also with the comparison with QGC Mavlink Inspector.

Title: Switch to industrial ci
Body: Another approach to switch...

Title: CI use industrial ci for travis tests
Body: It supports more distributions  than our script.

Title: Wheel odometry plugin added
Body: This PR aims to make possible computing of wheel odometry on a companion computer with encoders connected to autopilot.  Supersedes PR #863.  Connected PRs:  [mavlink/mavlink #799](https://github.com/mavlink/mavlink/pull/799)   [ArduPilot/mavlink #55](https://github.com/ArduPilot/mavlink/pull/55)   [ArduPilot/ardupilot #7252](https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/pull/7252)

Title: Added RPYrT and uncrustified
Body: Tested in SITL and flight arena with an Iris drone.     Changes to PX4 Firmware were also needed  PR under way.

Title: px4_config set the thrust_scaling to one by default
Body: This should be set to unitary by default  as being 0 means there's no thrust.    @lamping7 FYI.    @vooon what's the possibility of having a 0.28.1 minor release to bring this? The reason is that this is currently breaking PX4 CI.

Title: Update apm_config yaml Adding thrust_scaling to 1 0 in setpoint_raw msg
Body: Setting thrust_scaling in the setpoint_raw message (in my case  to use /mavros/setpoint_raw/attitude)  Without it  when using Gazebo  get the following problem  "Recieved thrust  but ignore_thrust is true: the most likely cause of this is a failure to specify the thrust_scaling parameters on px4/apm_config.yaml. Actuation will be ignored." from the function void attitude_cb in setpoint_raw.cpp (http://docs.ros.org/kinetic/api/mavros/html/setpoint__raw_8cpp_source.html)

Title: Extras update odom plugin to send Mavlink ODOMETRY msgs
Body: This updates the `odom` plugin to send [`ODOMETRY`](http://mavlink.org/messages/common#ODOMETRY) Mavlink msgs instead of [`LOCAL_POSITION_NED_COV`](http://mavlink.org/messages/common#LOCAL_POSITION_NED_COV) + [`ATT_COV`](http://mavlink.org/messages/common#ATTITUDE_QUATERNION_COV)  which required an higher bandwidth given the size of `LOCAL_POSITION_NED_COV`. Also  this merges the odometry data into the same message  removing the need for posteriors sync of the pose and velocity data  which would get to the FCU at different time frames.  This will be followed by the respective support for the PX4 Pro firmware.

Title: Solving default frame consistency in config files
Body: Solving default frame consistency in config files #789     * Changing the `local_origin` frame to `map` for consistency.  * Correction of the `global_position/frame_id` and `local_position/frame_id` to map frame

Title: TypoFix Update apm_config yaml
Body: Seems to be a typo to fix. There is a space to remove for the setpoint_raw. Without it  apm.launch is not working.

Title: LANDING_TARGET coder and decoder
Body: This allows to receive and send data through `LANDING_TARGET` message. I convert the angles and distance (from which I compute the magnitude of XYZ vector) into `PoseStamped` messages or publish transform  and vice-versa. Please check the math so everything is OK.

Title: use direclty radians in yaml files
Body: Fix for https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/issues/1210

Title: remove leading space before setpoint_raw in apm_config yaml
Body: Possible regression from: https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/commit/762895ccc01a3ae3b2de9a3f4dfc894afdd65668    This space causes an error when running `roslaunch`:    ```  error loading <rosparam> tag:          file /opt/ros/kinetic/share/mavros/launch/apm_config.yaml contains invalid YAML:  while parsing a block mapping    in "<string>"  line 4  column 1:      startup_px4_usb_quirk: false      ^  expected <block end>  but found '<block mapping start>'    in "<string>"  line 103  column 2:       setpoint_raw:       ^  XML is <rosparam command="load" file="$(arg config_yaml)"/>  The traceback for the exception was written to the log file  ```

Title: WIP Odom Plugin and TF tree fix
Body: This is a first step to get a clean tf tree together with a tested and simple odom plugin.  The number of option for parent and child frame of the odom msg that is sent over mavlink is reduced at the moment.   In order to clean up the tf tree  I would like to let the local_position plugin publish the tf between "local_origin" and "fcu". This would require renaming the frame name that is set in the px4_config to "local_origin" and "fcu".

Title: Mavros integration with moveit
Body: This pull request makes the following contributions:  1. Added a simple launch file for visaulizing px4-iris with rviz. I saw there was a bit of confusion on how to launch it in rviz since rviz used urdf while px4 loads an sdf file in gazebo. So it just gives a simple solution to new users.    2. A new package named mavros-moveit was added that contains a moveit config  a moveit controller-manager  and an action server that is called by the controller manager. The mavros_moveit_config package defines the attachment of the 'map' frame with 'base_link' frame through a virtual joint and defines the controller configuration. The trajectories generated by moveit are sent to the vehicle through the joint control action server defined in the mavros_moveit_actions package. The action server receives the trajectory on execution callback  arms the robot  and sends it to OFFBOARD mode. After that  it sends the trajectory commands to the robot through the setpoint_position/local topic. Once the robot finishes following the trajectory commands  the server sends the robot to AUTO.LOITER mode and returns.

Title: TF tree and odometry plugin
Body: With this PR a proper tf tree is built and the odometry plugin simplified. This should simplify providing the FCU with external position/odometry information.    Fixes #1293    The suggested changes include:  - odom plugin is not publishing tfs anymore.  - multiple static tfs are published in uas_data.cpp. (includes a fix proposed by @mhkabir )  - transform between local frame and body frame is published by local_position.     (needed to change the frame_id in px4_config.yaml)  - change default frame_id in px4_config.yaml for all plugin.  (to be discussed)  - simplify the odom plugin to support less frame options.  - fixed inconsistent usage and naming of transformations.    UPDATED: tf tree (including frames that are published by Realsense T265 VIO sensor):  ![Screenshot from 2019-09-20 10-22-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23532607/65311425-97cbcc00-db90-11e9-8f86-3ea0109c5edc.png)    The send odometry messages  both to and from FCU  have been tested. If you want to test it your self  you have to wait for the Firmware PR that will solve some confusion in mavlink_receiver.cpp and mavlink_messages.cpp    @TSC21 @mhkabir

Title: distance_sensor Allow configurable variance window size
Body: Currently ```distance_sensor``` plugin from ```mavros_extras``` uses a sample window with a hardcoded size to calculate distance sensor variance that is sent to the autopilot. This results in incorrectly large variances for low-frequency sensors (especially "smart" sensors that calculate variance themselves)  especially during takeoff and landing. To compensate for that I suggest adding a parameter to ```distance_sensor``` with the desired window size.    This P/R introduces a new parameter  ```variance_window_size```  to the ```distance_sensor``` plugin. It controls how many samples will be used in the (co)variance calculation  and defaults to 50 (the old  hardcoded size). If this parameter is set to 0 or a negative value  the variance calculations are disabled  and the distance sensor (co)variance is set to 0.

Title: convert mavros_msgs to ROS 2
Body: This should target a `ros2` branch or equivalent    First commit ignores the other packages of this repository  Second commit changes package.xml and CMake to build with ROS2  Third commit renames the message failing to compile in ROS2 and adds a ros1_bridge mapping rule file to be able to use it over the ros1_bridge.  I'm open to suggestions regarding the message renaming. The issue is that underscores are not allowed in message names in ROS2  so I changed it to CamelCase    Note: I didn't port the utilities from the include directories in this PR  this can be done in this PR if necessary or in a follow-up    connects to https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/issues/1000

Title: Feature upstream merge
Body: - Merge in recent mavros upstream.  - Add voliro custom messages -> renamed to omav  - Requires [omavlink](https://github.com/ethz-asl/omavlink/tree/feature/omav_extras)

Title: Feature all control
Body: Add messages:   - AllocationMatrix  - AttitudeThrustTarget  - TiltAngleTarget  - TiltrotorActuatorCommands  - WrenchTarget

Title: Mission item int
Body: This pull request adds a class that inherits from MISSION_ITEM_INT and allows for the usage of it with the parameter use_mission_item_int if it's not given it will use the flight controller capabilities. I used cog where it felt practical  I used boost variant to improve code reuse slightly. I am curious if I should have used cog for handle_mission_item and handle_mission_item_int since they are very similar.  I switched the send_waypoint and waypoint vectors to storing the ROS messages instead of the mavlink messages so that they can be converted to float or int at will without worrying about precision loss. I added 2 new states specifically for the _INT messages in order to help with the fallback to the non _INT message in the case that use_mission_item_int is set to true but it is not supported by the flight controller(not really an issue for Ardupilot but might help on other flight stacks).   I was able to test the push and pull functionality for both INT and float messages using push and pull. I was unable to test it on PX4  when I tried pushing waypoints it gave me the messages:  WP: upload failed: Command is not supported.  FCU: IGN MISSION_ITEM: Busy     I was running the jmavsim sitl and have not used px4 before so I was unsure if it was a problem with the plugin or something about the simulator I was not getting if. So help to verify on PX4 would be appreciated.    This should resolve #1375

Title: Add error message in install_geographiclib_datasets sh
Body: Now script hasn't got error handler. Some time ago it was the problem with SourceForge mirrors. But this script didn't print any errors. And it was so difficult to understand  what the problem with dataset.    After path if dataset isn't downloaded  the script will write an error meaasge.

Title: mavros_msgs Ros2
Body: This updates https://github.com/mavlink/mavros/pull/1007 to master and builds with ROS Crystal.    This PR will require https://github.com/ros-geographic-info/geographic_info/pull/26 to work

Title: distance_sensor Fill horizontal_fov vertical_fov quaternion
Body: Currently  the `distance_sensor` plugin does not fill the `horizontal_fov`  `vertical_fov` and `quaternion` fields of the [`DISTANCE_SENSOR`](https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html#DISTANCE_SENSOR) message. This results in uninitialized values being sent to the flight controller.    This P/R fills in the `horizontal_fov` and `vertical_fov` fields from the `field_of_view` field of the `sensor_msgs/Range` message. It also sets the quaternion to zero (it is not used unless the orientation is set to `MAV_SENSOR_ROTATION_CUSTOM`  and the message description says: "Set it to 0 if invalid.").

Title: mavros_extras obstacle_distance Change namespace add angle_offset
Body: While trying to set up collision prevention  I've found several issues with the `obstacle_distance` plugin:  * The parameter namespace for `obstacle_distance` is `obstacle`  which is not very discoverable;  * `angle_offset` is always zero in the MAVLink message.    This P/R changes the namespace to match the plugin name  adds an example parameter in `px4_config.yaml` (I'm not familiar with Ardupilot  not sure the plugin works with it)  and uses `angle_min` from ROS `sensor_msgs::LaserScan` as `angle_offset`. This worked for me with a D435+depthimage_to_laserscan (and a simple node to "flip" the laserscan message).

Title: Add rcl_interfaces dependency
Body: Potential fix for #1584
